item.title: Brian Douglas - Your Next Open Source Contribution [w/ASL Interpreting]
item.description:
Note: The opening moments have closed captions until the interpreter begins.
Today Open Source is ubiquitous and comprises nearly 80% ‚Äì 90% of the code in a ‚Äútypical‚Äù application. There is a need to use Open Source to stay competitive, but what about the need to use open source to advance your career?
In this talk, I will talk through actionable ways to make open-source contributions to grow your career. --- Brian Douglas is a Developer Advocate at GitHub where he works on increasing use of the GitHub API by iterating on the onboarding process and helping users with evergreen technical content.
Brian Douglas https://twitter.com/blacktocats - Blacktocats ERG Twitter Brian on Twitter: https://twitter.com/bdougieYO
item.author: (JuneteenthConf)

item.title: February 18, 2020 - Giving Blazor a ViewState?
item.description:
Web Forms has ViewState and Blazor manages state in memory... is there a way to re-make Web Forms ViewState for Blazor to help make migration easier? That's our task in this episode
27:47 - You're telling people not to use the ViewState for new stuff, so step 1: use it and get the move in. Step 2: start refactoring to use better practices. Without step 1 you can't do step 2 29:17 - I can't sell a change if I have to rewrite a ton of stuff just to move to Blazor. 30:10 - Remember that rewrites are dangerous, refactors are much safer. 40:58 - Ok, but do we like WaitForAssertion instead of VerifyAsyncChange? 1:12:58 - Does it work with VB's inline XML support? 1:38:55 - Has anyone hosted WPF UI elements in Winforms? 1:39:48 - When will MS make stuff open source?
Source code at: https://github.com/FritzAndFriends/BlazorWebFormsComponents Broadcasted live on Twitch -- Watch live at https://www.twitch.tv/csharpfritz
item.author: (Jeffrey T. Fritz)

item.title: February 19, 2020 - Blazor Component Updates to Support DataBinding
item.description:
In this video, Fritz walks through ensuring that the new DataBinder that we built in a previous video works on the FormView component.
27:32 - Is there an official explanation of the name Blazor? 28:57 - What is the difference between a logo and an icon? 1:08:33 - What is .NET? 1:09:42 - Is there a way to develop an app that can generate static pages so I can put the generated pages on multipage sites? 1:27:24 - Does anyone know if it's possible to have a Component only render it's 'Content' (Child Content) if a certain condition is true inside the component itself? 1:29:22 - How popular is F# and is it worth learning? 1:48:04 - Do you suggest I learn Blazor, MVC, Web Forms, or something else?
Source code at: https://github.com/FritzAndFriends/BlazorWebFormsComponents Broadcasted live on Twitch -- Watch live at https://www.twitch.tv/csharpfritz
item.author: (Jeffrey T. Fritz)

item.title: February 16, 2020 - Open Source C#, Blazor, and the DataBinder
item.description:
In this episode, Jeff talks about mimicking the ASP.NET Web Forms DataBinder object so that it's syntax can be re-used in Blazor
11:13 - Do you know if there were any plans to support XAML in Blazor so it would be like programming WPF for web? 16:09 - Anyone know of any dotnet core open-source projects easy to pop in and contribute to? 39:46 - Are you going to add AutoPostBack? 46:39 - Does making DataBinder a Component make it much heavier to execute/needs too much resources? 47:04 - This is using Reflection, right? 1:43:33 - When working with Git branches, should you a) merge 'origin' dev or b) pull 'origin' dev to get changes from dev into the working feature branch and what's the difference? 1:45:40 - Isn't a pull a fetch and merge in one git command?
Source code at: https://github.com/FritzAndFriends/BlazorWebFormsComponents
Broadcasted live on Twitch -- Watch live at https://www.twitch.tv/csharpfritz
item.author: (Jeffrey T. Fritz)

item.title: CVE-2020-1472: 'Zerologon' Vulnerability in Netlogon Could Allow Attackers to Hijack Windows Domain Controller
item.description: Security researchers reveal how the cryptographic authentication scheme in Netlogon can be exploited to take control of a Windows domain controller (DC).

item.title: Max Hodak - What is relativity, anyway?
item.description: Relativity is one of my favorite topics in physics. Its origins were almost pure logic puzzle science, which in my opinion is one of the most fun and satisfying types of science. Most people have a vague sense of what relativity is ‚Äì the speed of light is finite, and something about time travel? ‚Äì but they don‚Äôt really know what it is, which is too bad because the principles are very simple, and the results are pretty awesome.
item.author: (September 2020)

item.description: I‚Äôve long maintained that persistence is one of the main qualities you need in order to succeed with your (software) project. In order to manage to ship a product that truly conquers the world. By continuously and never-ending keeping at it: polishing away flaws and adding good features. On and on and on.

item.title: Brittney Braxton - Journaling as a Dev [w/ASL Interpreting]
item.description:
Note: There are initial captions directly in the video until the interpreter begins.
Are you working with impact and purpose? Are you solidly attuned on what you're doing month-to-month with your role? How difficult is it for you to track your accomplishments at work? If any of these questions lead to uncertain answers, then you should learn what it means to journal professionally as a dev. This talk will cover my exploration into journaling and its application to tracking my goals and progress as a software engineer. I will discuss how to set up your journal for any goals and how to score on your performance review! ----- Brittney is a software engineer who loves a good cup of tea. In her spare time, she draws illustrations for teaNotes.dev on Instagram. Brittney strives to connect with folks who geek out over code with hopes to contribute to a friendly and inviting tech community.
Brittney Braxton: Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/teanotes.dev/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/mintiib
item.author: (JuneteenthConf)
